events.title: Earthquake in Shaanxi, China
events.description: One of the deadliest earthquakes in history struck Shaanxi province in China, killing approximately 830,000 people.
events.significance: Marked as the most catastrophic earthquake by death toll, highlighting the vulnerability of ancient populations to seismic disasters.

events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte crowns himself Emperor
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of the French in a ceremony held at Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris, bypassing the Pope's traditional role.
events.significance: Signified the rise of Napoleon's power and the establishment of the First French Empire.

events.title: Sharpeville Massacre in South Africa
events.description: South African police opened fire on a crowd of peaceful protesters against apartheid pass laws in Sharpeville, killing 69 people.
events.significance: Brought international attention to apartheid and became a catalyst for the anti-apartheid movement.

events.title: Twitter launched to the public
events.description: The social media platform Twitter was launched publicly, enabling users to post short messages called tweets.
events.significance: Revolutionized social communication and information sharing in the digital age.
